message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.ET, cs.LG, cs.AR 

This paper proposes a method for obfuscating the functionality of digital standard cells to protect intellectual property. It involves using a differential threshold logic gate (TLG) to implement a subset of Boolean functions of n variables that are linear threshold functions. This is a topic that falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) as it deals with protecting digital IP. The paper also discusses the architecture of the TLG, which involves setting the threshold voltages of input transistors to selectively remove variables from the support set of the function. This is a topic that falls under the categories of digital circuits (cs.DC) and electronic devices and circuits (cs.ET). The paper also discusses the use of TLGs in complex logic circuits, which is a topic that falls under the category of logic in computer science (cs.LG). Finally, the paper discusses the synthesis and simulation of the obfuscated designs, which is a topic that falls under the category of computer architecture (cs.AR).
